The Buddha then emitted a great light of purple golden color, illuminating Jade Maiden's room. The Buddha manifested the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks. When Jade Maiden saw the Buddha's light and appearance, she was greatly frightened and fearful. She then came out and paid homage to the Buddha.
The Buddha told Jade Maiden:

The way of women should not rely on being beautiful to give rise to arrogance. Being physically beautiful is not true beauty. Only when one's mind and conduct are upright is one truly beautiful and loved by others. One should not rely on one's facial beauty to be arrogant and self-indulgent, for one will be born lowly in one's next life and become a servant for others.
The Buddha told Jade Maiden:
The way of women has three obstacles and ten evils. Do you not realize this?
Jade Maiden said to the Buddha:
What are the three obstacles and ten evils?

The Buddha told Jade Maiden:ğŸ”½First, women are not allowed to be kings, ministers, or great officials. Second, women are not allowed to be elders or leaders. Third, women are not allowed to be Buddhas. These are the three obstacles.

First, when young, one is obstructed by one's parents; second, after marriage, one is obstructed by one's husband; third, when old, one is obstructed by one's children; these are the three obstructions.
What are the ten evils?
First, when born, one's parents are not happy.
Second, raising one is tasteless.
Third, one is always worried about losing propriety in marriage.
Fourth, one fears people everywhere.
Fifth, one is separated from one's parents.
Sixth, one relies on others' doors.
Seventh, being pregnant is very difficult.
Eighth, giving birth is difficult.
Ninth, one always fears one's husband.
Tenth, one is never independent; these are the ten evils.
When Jade heard the Buddha speak of the three obstructions and ten evils, her body and mind trembled in fear, and she said to the Buddha:
I only wish that the World-Honored One would teach me the way of being a wife.
The Buddha told Jade:
The way of being a wife should have five aspects.
What are the five?
The first is like a mother-wife, the second is like a minister-wife, the third is like a sister-wife, the fourth is a maid-wife, and the fifth is a wife-wife.
What is meant by a mother-wife?
Because she loves her husband like a son, she is called a mother-wife.
What is meant by a minister-wife?
Because she serves her husband like a lord, she is called a minister-wife.
What is meant by a sister-wife?
Because she serves her husband like an elder brother, she is called a sister-wife.
What is meant by a maid-wife?
Because she serves her husband like a concubine, she is called a maid-wife.
What is meant by a wife-wife?

Turning away from relatives and going to a distant place, forever leaving the affection and love of one's birth, being intimate and having the same mind but different forms, respectfully serving and being cautious without any arrogant thoughts, serving well inside and outside the home, the family being prosperous and abundant, receiving guests and praising good reputation, this is the way of a wife-wife.
The Buddha told Yujia:
Serving one's mother-in-law, husband, and wife also has five good deeds and three evils.
Yujia said to the Buddha:
What are the five good deeds and three evils?
The Buddha told Yujia:
First, to sleep late and rise early, to manage household affairs, to not eat the best food oneself, but to offer it to the mother-in-law and husband.
Second, to take care of household goods and not let them be lost.
Third, to be careful with one's words, to be patient, and to have little anger.
Fourth, to be dignified and cautious, always fearing that one is not doing enough.
Fifth, to single-mindedly be respectful and filial to the mother-in-law and husband, to have a good reputation, to bring joy to relatives, and to be praised by others. These are the five good things.
What are the three bad things?
First, to sleep early before dark and not get up until the sun rises, to be scolded by the husband and in turn to complain and scold him.
Second, to eat the good food oneself and give the bad food to the mother-in-law and husband, to be deceitful and have myriad forms of deception.

Third, to not think about making a living, to roam about in the world, to talk about others' good and bad points, to seek out others' strengths and weaknesses, to cause quarrels, to be hated by relatives, and to be despised by others. These are the three bad things.
Yujia heard the Buddha speak of the five good deeds and three evils, and with faith, respect, joy, and a sense of shame, she said to the Buddha:
As a disciple, I was foolish. Before seeing the Buddha and hearing the Dharma, I made immeasurable self-destructive mistakes and various hindrances without realizing it.

Now that I have heard the teachings, my mind is enlightened, and I realize that my past actions were wrong. From now on, I will change my ways, cultivate, follow the teachings of the Venerable One, and dare not disobey again.
I only wish that the Holy One would have compassion, save me, accept my repentance, allow me to remove my mistakes, accept my five precepts, and make me a disciple.

The Buddha said:
Listen carefully and contemplate it well.
Yujia said:
Yes, World-Honored One!
I joyfully accept and uphold it.
The Buddha told Yujia:
One who upholds one precept, their hands and body do not kill, and they show kindness to all beings.
One who upholds two precepts, they are pure, humble, and do not steal, reducing their own to help others.
One who upholds three precepts, they are chaste and do not engage in sexual misconduct.
One who upholds four precepts, they do not speak falsely, even in jest.
One who upholds five precepts, they stay far from alcohol, do not drink, and do not commit any evil.
Upholding the precepts, like saving one's head from burning;
Observing one's own body, not able to last long, life as precarious as lightning, as fast as wind passing through a courtyard;
Youth and strength will surely decline, do not rely on one's appearance, should diligently make progress, abandon worldly glory, like the bodhisattva's teachings.
Your practice now can reach Buddhahood, the Buddha Way cannot be unlearned, the sutras cannot be unlistened to.
I have now attained Buddhahood, praised for achieving the Mahayana teachings, no male or female, those who enjoy hearing the Dharma, according to their wishes, will attain it.
Jade Maiden addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
What kind of glory will the good wife attain?
What kind of misfortune will the bad wife incur?
The Buddha told Yujia:

The good wife will be honored and respected by her relatives in this life, receive blessings and be reborn in the heavens. When her heavenly life ends, she will be reborn in the human realm as the child of a king or noble. Wherever she is born, everyone will respect her.

The bad wife will be hated and despised by everyone, and they will wish for her early death. After death, she will fall into the hells, the animal realm, or become a slave, transmigrating there without end.

When Yujia heard the teaching on the good and bad wives, she became fearful and practiced with sincerity, immediately attaining the path. She carved and embroidered, made pearl and jeweled canopies, hung silk banners and canopies, burned various famous incense, circumambulated the pagoda, and sang praises that reached the ten directions. Those who saw it rejoiced and bowed to the temple hall.
